import React from 'react'; import { Container, Row, Col } from "react-bootstrap"; import Santeros1 from "../images/Santeros1.png" var canario_passarinho = "https://www.recantocaipira.com.br/duplas/canario_passarinho/canario_passarinho.html"; var furia = "https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RJ8V-DpP1gM"; var condor = "https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Czu7Yc6Fnmo" const Texts = () => { return(

Los Santeros

Line-up:

Pedro Bergamo - Acoustic Guitar & Vocals

Satu Lankinen - Accordion & Vocals

Rolando Camilo - Drums & Vocals

Seppo Salmi - Electric Guitar

Pedro Augusto de Souza Bergamo was born in Franca, a small city of shoemakers in the interior of São Paulo state, in Brazil. He was named after his maternal grandfather, who was a santero and raised by his mom and step-father who owned a guitar and a fan of 70's British rock. He is biological son of Pedro Bergamo and nephew of Antonio Bergamo from the accomplished Sertanejo duo "Canário e Passarinho" .

Coming from a poor upbringing, he started learning music by 6 through public municipal initiatives like EMIM. When he was 12, his mom joined a presbiterian church in which they would allow him to play acoustic guitar. He played through 5 years in the worship group, where he developed most of his aural skills. When he was 18, after being expelled from the band for his temperament, he quit the church and moved to his father apartment in São Paulo singing and playing in hard rock and metal bands. He also worked as a seller in a CD store and as a producer in a Sertanejo and Forró studio thanks to his father influence.

In his twenties, after entering a drunk fight which almost cost his life, he returned to Franca and joined his step-dad leather business. He started his studies, which would eventually earn him a master degree in chemistry. Some years later, his father presented him a "viola caipira", a Brazilian traditional instrument, but he had no interest on it, since he had little interest in Brazilian music. However, at one event his cousin grabbed the instrument and played "O último condor" by Almir Sater . Since then he started to compose music in Portuguese, influenced by singer-songwriters like Almir Sater and Zé Ramalho.

By coincidence a long time friend was putting a magician act and needed some original music. He wrote a theater script and original songs for the act "O circo de Aracnídea" but after the debut show, in which one actor throwed a bomb at the stage shuting down the sound system, the show was never performed again. In this period he also worked as a chemistry teacher and a radio host, besides playing in a Nirvana cover band and original rock bands like Blind a man and Furia das máquinas. When he was 27 years he moved to Finland to continue his scientific studies. He worked one year as a researcher in modelling and simulation in Pori Research Center of Outotec, then at "Digital Solutions" in Outotec's Helsinki office. During this period he produced and released two of his songs with the Finnish producer Joel Lindfors: "Lago Brasil" and "Nos dois merecemos viver". In 2019 he moved to Sweden to take courses at Luleå University of Technology.

In the year 2020, he lost someone close due to suicide, around the same period he was visiting a friend in São Paulo. By the same time he started to read "Ariano Suassuna", which is a prolific anti-imperialist author and influenced his choice record songs from the "Circo de Aracnídea" infamus show, with only Brazilian instruments. The songs were "Abrahadabra", "Flores pelo céu" and "Feiticeiro Esteve Aqui". In the same year he returned to Finland and joined the Latin band "La orquesta del fin del mundo", where he met Rolando, Satu and Seppo. After a rearrangement of the band, he quit and formed "Pedro Bergamo & Los Santeros" with some of the integrants, which focus on Pedro's original music.

); }; export default Texts;
